tasks.name: Exploration
tasks.objective: Explore all three layout engines to determine optimal combination: all 3, 2, or just 1? Evaluate value vs. complexity trade-off for each.
tasks.unlocks: Evidence-based decision on which engine(s) to use and how they complement each other
tasks.diagram:
┌───────────────────────────┐
│          PoC 0            │
│       EXPLORATION         │
│       ✅ Complete         │
│                           │
│ Engines Evaluated         │
│   • Grandalf (Python)     │
│   • Graphviz (C)          │
│   • ascii-dag (Rust)      │
│                           │
│ Decision                  │
│   • 2 engines selected    │
│   • Grandalf: positioning │
│   • Graphviz: edge hints  │
└───────────────────────────┘

tasks.name: Design and Architecture
tasks.objective: Architect the foundation based on PoC0 findings. Build LayoutEngine abstraction, Canvas renderer, EdgeRouter with >90% test coverage
tasks.unlocks: Solid, well-tested foundation for diagram generation

tasks.name: Edge Routing
tasks.objective: Implement edge routing and canvas unicode fix to produce clean ASCII diagrams with boxes connected by edges
tasks.unlocks: Complete rendering (boxes + edges) for MC integration; Production pipeline from DAG to ASCII output

tasks.name: Box Connectors and Smart Routing
tasks.objective: Implement box connectors and smart routing patterns (trunk-and-split, merge routing) for cleaner ASCII diagrams
tasks.unlocks: Cleaner diagrams with box connectors; Trunk-and-split pattern for fan-out scenarios; Merge pattern for fan-in scenarios; Foundation for more advanced edge routing
